roll20.name: Roll20
roll20.description: An online platform and companion mobile app for tabletop game management.

roles.title: Junior Software Developer
descriptions: Worked on implementing Roll20's first Node.js/Express microservice via TypeScript/JavaScript and Mongo/Mongoose. Included a flexible GraphQLAPI, Atlas search integration, authorization with OAuth/OpenID via our Hydra auth server, and data importing from a legacy Postgres database.

Converted legacy permissions from scattered, disparate permissions across multiple Postgres tables into one polymorphic Postgres table for easier access, better testability in RSpec, and to offer a single source of truth.
Integrated new Cypress end to end test suites across a variety of Roll20 features. Updated the primary codebase Rpsec testing setup for organization and efficiency.
Developed the first iteration of the Dungeons and Dragons mobile character sheet for the Roll20 mobile app beta.
Converted key Roll20 compendium pages from legacy Erb/Haml code to modern Javascript via Vue, Vuex, and Vue Router.
Stepped in as a temporary Product Owner and assisted with roadmap development, critical project execution, and daily team management.
Worked alongside various cross-functional teams to develop any other features, functions, and bug fixes needed for the Roll20 platform, both inside and outside the Virtual Tabletop
Assisted various non-technical teams and team members in project ideation, bug reporting, and general support.

roles.title: Customer Support Team Lead
descriptions: Lead a team of several customer representatives in managing Roll20's various support channels.
Reviewed various customer service analytics (CSAT, SLA, LT) and SOO's and guided team in advancing associated goals.
Proposed and managed several vertical and horizontal projects and initiatives including but not limited to Roll20 Help Center improvements and bug troubleshooting process updates.

roles.title: Customer Agent
descriptions: Provided customer service and troubleshooting through a variety of mediums including Jira Service Desk, Roll20 Forums, Twitter, Facebook, and Reddit.
Investigated, identified, and reported bugs and errors from Roll20 user base and other end points.
Assisted in creating, managing, and maintaining public-facing Roll20 documentation. Supported and processed the transfer of Roll20 documentation from in-house Wiki to Confluence.
Provided support wherever and however needed to other internal teams.

roles.title: Junior Developer
descriptions: Developed a web application for a client using AngularJS, NodeJS, ExpressJS, MongoDB, and Mongoose.
